fr.eikasus.objectsmyfriends.model.bll.interfaces

Interface ItemManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ItemManagerImpl

    public interface ItemManager
    Interface used for implementing item manager class.

    This interface defines all the specific methods that must be implemented to manage items. Methods present in the interface implementation are allowed to use as many as data access objects required to accomplish their goal. The access of one of data access object method by the controllers is strictly forbidden.

    See Also:
    add(String, String, Date, Date, int, User, Category), find(Long), findByCriteria(User, UserRole, Search, Category, String), update(Item, HashMap), delete(List), deleteByCriteria(User, UserRole, Search, Category, String)

    • Method Detail

      • setManagerFactory

        void setManagerFactory(ManagerFactory managerFactory)
        Set the manager factory.

        This method retrieves the manager factory to allow the instance methods to access others managers.

        Parameters:
        managerFactory - Manager factory instance.

      • add

        Item add(java.lang.String name,
         java.lang.String description,
         java.util.Date biddingStart,
         java.util.Date biddingEnd,
         int initialPrice,
         User seller,
         Category category)
  throws ModelException
        Create a full qualified item.

        This method creates and saves an item into the persistence unit. All parameters are required to complete the action. If one of that parameters is wrong, an exception occurs and nothing is saved.

        Parameters:
        name - Short name of the item.
        description - Description of the item.
        biddingStart - Start of the bidding.
        biddingEnd - End of the bidding.
        initialPrice - Initial price of the idem.
        seller - Seller of the item.
        category - Category of the item.
        Returns:
        Newly created item and added to the database.
        Throws:
        ModelException - In case of problem.

      • find

        java.util.List<Item> find(java.lang.Long identifier)
                   throws ModelException
        Search a specific item.

        Search a specific item in the persistence unit whose identifier is the one supplied in parameter. If this supplied parameter is null, then all items are returned by this method.

        Parameters:
        identifier - Item identifier or null for all.
        Returns:
        List of items found.
        Throws:
        ModelException - In case of pb.

      • findByCriteria

        java.util.List<Item> findByCriteria(User user,
                                    UserRole role,
                                    @NotNull
                                    @NotNull Search search,
                                    Category category,
                                    java.lang.String keywords)
                             throws ModelException
        Search items using criteria.

        Search items in the persistence unit that are related to the supplied user. His role determine the nature of the search criteria.

        Parameters:
        user - User to search for.
        role - Role of the supplied user (seller or buyer)
        search - Searching criteria.
        category - Category of items searched.
        keywords - Keywords on item name.
        Returns:
        List of items found.
        Throws:
        ModelException - In case of pb.

      • update

        void update(Item item,
            java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties)
     throws ModelException
        Update item properties.

        This method update the properties of the supplied item. Each property new value should be supplied as a pair of key/value, a key representing the exact name or the user property, including case. If a key as an undefined property name, an exception is generated.

        Parameters:
        item - Item to be updated.
        properties - Item properties to update.
        Throws:
        ModelException - In case of problem.

      • delete

        void delete(@NotNull
            @NotNull java.util.List<Item> items)
     throws ModelException
        Delete items.

        This method deletes the supplied items from the persistence unit. This should be used even if one item has to te deleted. Be aware that all associated information will be deleted too, like images, bids and pickup place.

        Parameters:
        items - List of item to delete.
        Throws:
        ModelException - In case of problem.

      • deleteByCriteria

        void deleteByCriteria(User user,
                      UserRole role,
                      @NotNull
                      @NotNull Search search,
                      Category category,
                      java.lang.String keywords)
               throws ModelException
        Delete items using criteria.

        This method delete items according to criteria supplied in parameter. The relation between each criterion is a logical and. Except the user and its role, all other parameters can be null.

        Parameters:
        user - User to search for.
        role - Role of the supplied user (seller or buyer)
        search - Searching criteria.
        category - Category of items searched.
        keywords - Keywords on item name.
        Throws:
        ModelException - In case of pb.
